Node.definition: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

Node.gloss: to receive as a vision|to have a vision
Node.definition: = process by which humans perceive something in a dream or trance, or as a supernatural apparition
= man; ► prophet (נָבִיא)
= male person speaking on behalf of a deity
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
particle linking an event to a point in time; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in time Y

= referent to an unknown point in time; ► normally used with the purpose of finding out which point in time is intended; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that this point of time may never arrive

Node.gloss: to cry out|to cry for help
Node.definition: = action by which humans and animals raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else
= action by which humans raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else
= to behave aggressively towards someone with which one has a relationship; ► usually in order to enrich oneself in one way or another
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the help of humans in need, whether in military, civil or judicial contexts
= causative action by which humans or deities cause humans to perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes
= great wickedness and depravity, as a trait of certain human beings, which is expressed in thoughts, words, and actions; ≈ regarded as unacceptable and worthy of punishment by God

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= action by which humans or wild animals attack other humans and kill, destroy and steal in the process
= to behave aggressively towards someone with which one has a relationship; ► usually in order to enrich oneself in one way or another

Node.gloss: dispute, quarrel, strife, argument|(law)suit, case, indictment
Node.definition: = state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons, perhaps even involving a deity
= state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons
literally: to arise; hence: = process by which an event starts happening
= causative action by which humans or deities offer instruction to (other) humans, ► aimed to teach the recipients wisdom and good behavior
literally: to go out; hence: = process by which an event starts taking place, originating from a certain deity, person, or place
poetic term: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, usually in the future
= practices that conform to the laws of God

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
literally: to go out; hence: = process by which an event starts taking place, originating from a certain deity, person, or place
= practices that conform to the laws of God

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= action by which a person or deity carries out some purposeful activity, in order to create something or cause something to happen
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= state in which humans are confident with regard to another person or event, which means that this person is believed to be speaking the truth, or that this event is true

Node.gloss: to tell|to recount|to proclaim: to declare
Node.definition: = action by which humans communicate verbally to others about an event or situation, with focus on the contents rather than on the speech act

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= descendant of Chesed (כֶּשֶׂד) son of Nahor (נָחֹור) and their land

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= state in which humans are in a state of anger, lack compassion, and do not tolerate any opposition
literally: hastened; hence: = state in which humans are inclined to act rashly, out of anger or a lack of patience
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= action by which humans take ownership of land and other possessions
= location where a family or household lives, or where a deity is said to reside
= state of inspiring a mixture of both wonder and fear, because of a combination of fearsomeness and beauty
= state in which humans, deities, places and activities have qualities that inspire fear in others
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= practices that conform to the laws of God

literally: lifted up = state in which humans or deities have an elevated status, either in their own eyes or in the eyes of other people, ≈ which can either be good or bad, depending on whether this status is justified
literally: to go out; hence: = process by which an event starts taking place, originating from a certain deity, person, or place
= state in which animals and objects have the ability to move or act with speed ◄ due to lack of weight, agility, strength, training, or energy
= one of the great cat family, spotted but slightly smaller and with longer legs than leopards; extremely fast; ◄ Acinonyx jubatus; ► symbol of speed

= large domesticated solid hoofed quadruped; stockily built in comparison to today's horses, with shorter heads and thicker necks; about 122–142 cm tall, and 2.1 m long; its coat varies from dark to pale brown; it eats plants; ◄ Equus caballus; ► used in battle, both to ride and for pulling chariots; ≈ symbolic of military might; associated with the sun, which was said to ride across the sky in a chariot
= state in which animals are inclined to violent and dangerous activity ◄ as dangerous as a sharp knife

= wild, four footed, predatory canine; light brown fur, similar to jackal, but much bigger; ◄ Canis lupus; ► commonly prey on flocks; ≈ regarded as ravenous and fierce; symbol of roaming, opportunistic, dangerous, fierce, and clever banditry

= the time of day when the sun starts going down, when people leave their work and go home, have food, and go to sleep; this is also the time of the evening sacrifice, and the time when an unclean person who has gone through the cleansing rituals is declared clean, when fasting and mourning come to an end, and when the exposed body of an executed person needs to be removed
= horse; ► primarily used for soldiers to ride on, but also for agricultural purposes|= soldier riding a horse
= horse; ► primarily used for soldiers to ride on, but also for agricultural purposes|= soldier riding a horse
literally: to fly; hence: = action by which humans move with great speed ◄ like a bird

exact meaning unknown; possibly: = a grouping of large birds of prey with keen eyesight; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten; ≈ associated with large size and great strength, ability to fly great distances at high speed; symbol of protection, metaphor for God, but also symbol for death in battle
= action by which someone performs an event quickly
= action by which people or objects are removed from existence in a violent way ◄ as food that is eaten
= to behave aggressively towards someone with which one has a relationship; ► usually in order to enrich oneself in one way or another
= exact meaning unknown; possibly: = state indicating that all members of a group are involved in a similar activity
= to bring together people, animals, plants, and/or other things from different places for a common purpose

= minute fragments; ◄ resulting from wearing down of esp. siliceous rocks and found covering parts of the sea shore, river beds, deserts, etc.; ► contains materials for the production of dye and glass; ≈ symbol of large quantity
= a person or group that has been forcibly carried off to prison, into slavery, or resettlement
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= action by which someone speaks insulting words to someone else, ◄ out of a sense of superiority, ► intending to bring public shame upon that person
used in poetry only; = ruler of a nation or people

Node.gloss: laughing at|being confident in the face of
Node.definition: literally: laughing (at something); hence: = state in which humans have no fear for a certain people
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= area that has been fortified with the help of a strong and solid wall and possibly other defense works; ≈ associated with security

Node.gloss: to laugh at|to be confident in the face of
Node.definition: literally: to laugh (at something); hence: = state in which humans or animals have no fear for a certain situation

Node.gloss: to heap up|to pile up|to store up
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans pile up large quantities of objects in one place
= the loose natural substance of the earth's surface
= action by which humans or animals take control of (other) humans, animals, towns or land, usually with violence
= referent pointing to a specific point in time, either in the past or the future
= process by which an object or substance passs through a certain location with strength

= a natural movement of air, blowing in a particular direction, ranging in intensity from a light breeze to a heavy blast ; ≈ often regarded as the breath of God, but also associated with things that are without substance and cannot be grasped

Node.gloss: to be guilty|to be in the wrong|to have wronged
Node.definition: = to bear the responsiblity for an unlawful deed, that was committed either knowingly or unknowingly
= state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force
= generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

= state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well
= process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= action by which humans or deities carry out a verdict pronounced against an individual or group
= causative action by which humans or deities make objects or (other) humans different from what they were before
figurative extension of a rock as place of refuge: = deity that protects and provides refuge
literally: to judge; hence: = action by which humans or deities inflict a penalty on others as retribution for what they have done
literally: to lay as a foundation; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities assign a role to (other) humans
= state in which humans or deities are free from moral contamination

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

mostly used in a negated clause; = state in which an activity cannot be carried out, as a result of a lack of skill, strength, or ability of the agent, or other circumstances that make the activity impossible

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

Node.gloss: to act unfaithfully|to be treacherous|to deal treacherously|to break faith|to betray
Node.definition: = pattern of behavior by which humans act in a way which shows a lack of truthfulness and commitment, both in words and deeds
= action by which someone purposely refrains from responding, either with words or with actions

= causative action by which deities or humans cause other humans and objects to be removed from existence in a violent way, as if by swallowing up, either by direct intervention or by accomplishing this through the hands of others
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality

= collective designation of various cold blooded, aquatic vertebrates, having gills, usually fins, and typically an elongated body covered with scales; or, in a loosely sense, any of various other aquatic animals; ► an important source of food
= a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water
= a general term for small animals with short or no legs
= wooden rod about the length of a man, with a metal or bone point with barbs on one end, and a rope on the other end; ► thrown at fish or aquatic animals to kill and catch them
= causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or objects to go to a place that is situated at a higher elevation, by foot or carried by hand, or with the help of a vehicle
= causative action by which humans remove objects from their place with force

= long net hanging vertically in the water with floats at the upper edge and weights at the lower edge; ► drawn in by men working in boats or from shore; as the ends are drawn together to the boat or drawn ashore, fish are trapped in the area enclosed by the net; drawn in immediately after it has been spread out; ≈ associated with aggression and control
= to bring together people, animals, plants, and/or other things from different places for a common purpose

= circular net with weights and a draw rope around its edge of roughly 6 7.5 meters in diameter; ► thrown from a boat or the shore in a circular motion so that it lands with the net fully spread out on the water; the weights carry it down, trapping fish underneath; then the fisherman uses the draw rope to close the net and pull it back to himself; ≈ associated with aggression and control
= state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy
mainly in poetical texts: = state in which humans feel and show great joy

= the human activity of killing one or more animals as a religious sacrifice; usually part of the animal is offered to the deity and part is eaten by the worshipers; often accompanied by the burning of incense

= long net hanging vertically in the water with floats at the upper edge and weights at the lower edge; ► drawn in by men working in boats or from shore; as the ends are drawn together to the boat or drawn ashore, fish are trapped in the area enclosed by the net; drawn in immediately after it has been spread out; ≈ associated with aggression and control
= causative action by which humans set alight and cause smoke to rise from the sacrificial fat parts of an animal, of grain and other offerings, including incense ► as an offering to a deity

= circular net with weights and a draw rope around its edge of roughly 6 7.5 meters in diameter; ► thrown from a boat or the shore in a circular motion so that it lands with the net fully spread out on the water; the weights carry it down, trapping fish underneath; then the fisherman uses the draw rope to close the net and pull it back to himself; ≈ associated with aggression and control
= something that happens to someone; ◄ whether or not as recompense for what he/she has done
= any nutritious substance that people or animals eat or drink ► in order to maintain life and growth
= state in which food contains much fat; ≈ considered high quality
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation

= long net hanging vertically in the water with floats at the upper edge and weights at the lower edge; ► drawn in by men working in boats or from shore; as the ends are drawn together to the boat or drawn ashore, fish are trapped in the area enclosed by the net; drawn in immediately after it has been spread out; ≈ associated with aggression and control
= causative action by which someone takes the life of a person, animal, or plant in a violent way

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural

Node.gloss: to be concerned for|to have pity on|to show mercy|to spare
Node.definition: = process by which humans or deities experience an emotion of affection for a particular object or state of event; ► resulting in unwillingness to see that object come to harm or that event to be obstructed
